sentence.Network_cn: 他希望能争取到更重要的角色。

phrase.cizu_name: be carved on tablets of stone

jx.jx_en_mean: take something from a larger whole, especially with difficulty

lj.lj_ly: carving out a 5 per cent share of the overall vote.
lj.lj_ls: 在所有选票中分得５％的份额。

jx.jx_en_mean: establish or create something through painstaking effort

lj.lj_ly: he managed to carve out a successful photographic career for himself.
lj.lj_ls: 他终于为自己开辟了成功的摄影事业。

phrase.cizu_name: carve someone up informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: slash someone with a knife or other sharp object
drive aggressively into the path of another driver travelling in the same direction
divide something ruthlessly into separate areas or domains

lj.lj_ly: West Africa was carved up by the Europeans.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ceorfan 'cut, carve', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch kerven

entry.def: If you carve an object, you make it by cutting it out of a substance such as wood or stone. If you carve something such as wood or stone into an object, you make the object by cutting it out.

example.ex: One of the prisoners has carved a beautiful wooden chess set...
example.tran: 有个犯人刻了一副漂亮的木头象棋。

example.ex: He carves his figures from white pine...
example.tran: 他用白松木雕刻出那些人偶。

entry.def: If you carve writing or a design on an object, you cut it into the surface of the object.

example.ex: He carved his name on his desk...
example.tran: 他把名字刻在自己的课桌上。

example.ex: The ornately carved doors were made in the seventeenth century.
example.tran: 那些雕饰精美的门制于17世纪。

entry.def: If you carve a piece of cooked meat, you cut slices from it so that you can eat it.

example.ex: Andrew began to carve the chicken...

entry.def: If you carve a career or a niche for yourself, you succeed in getting the career or the position that you want by your own efforts.

example.ex: She has carved a niche for herself as a comic actor...
example.tran: 她作为喜剧演员已经闯出了一片天地。

example.ex: They may be loyally standing by their men, but they are also carving their own careers...
example.tran: 她们也许忠诚地支持着自己的丈夫，但她们也在开创自己的事业。

entry.def: If a road is carved through a place, it is built so that it goes through that place.

example.ex: Two three-lane roads will be carved through countryside.
example.tran: 将要修建两条三车道的公路穿过乡间。

means.word_mean: 2. engrave or cut by chipping away at a surface;

Sentence.sentence: That way, people still get the presentation of the dishes as they were designed, but can carve them up however they like," Hill says.

From self-service checkout lines at supermarket to industrial robots armed with saws and taught to carve up animal bodies in slaughter-houses, these ever-more-intelligent machines are now not just assisting workers but actually kicking them out of their jobs.

sentences.en: At the dinnertable, father's job is to carve the meat.
sentences.cn: 吃饭时, 爸爸的工作是切肉。

jushi.english: We carve and paint and we enjoy what is carved and painted.
jushi.chinese: 我们从事雕刻和绘画,我们也欣赏雕刻和绘画作品。

jushi.english: We carved their names on the stones so that future generations should know what they had done.
jushi.chinese: 我们把他们的名字刻在石头上,为的是让后人知道他们的作为。
